com.hr.expr.expression

Class Expr

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hr.expr.expression.Expr
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryExpr, ConditionalExpr, LiteralExpr, UnaryExpr, Variable

    public abstract class Expr
extends java.lang.Object
    A mathematical expression, built out of literal numbers, variables, arithmetic and relational operators, and elementary functions. It can be evaluated to get its value given its variables' current values. The operator names are from java.lang.Math where possible.

    • Method Detail

      • value

        public abstract double value()
        Calculate the expression's value.
        Returns:
        the value given the current variable values

      • makeLiteral

        public static Expr makeLiteral(double v)
        Make a literal expression.
        Parameters:
        v - the constant value of the expression
        Returns:
        an expression whose value is always v

      • makeApp1

        public static Expr makeApp1(int rator,
                            Expr rand)
        Make an expression that applies a unary operator to an operand.
        Parameters:
        rator - a code for a unary operator
        rand - operand
        Returns:
        an expression meaning rator(rand)

      • makeApp2

        public static Expr makeApp2(int rator,
                            Expr rand0,
                            Expr rand1)
        Make an expression that applies a binary operator to two operands.
        Parameters:
        rator - a code for a binary operator
        rand0 - left operand
        rand1 - right operand
        Returns:
        an expression meaning rator(rand0, rand1)

      • makeIfThenElse

        public static Expr makeIfThenElse(Expr test,
                                  Expr consequent,
                                  Expr alternative)
        Make a conditional expression.
        Parameters:
        test - `if' part
        consequent - `then' part
        alternative - `else' part
        Returns:
        an expression meaning `if test, then consequent, else alternative'
